title: 106_hr1113
content: The Act may be cited as the "Colusa Basin Watershed Integrated Resources Management Act" and authorizes assistance. The Secretary of the Interior may provide financial assistance to the Colusa Basin Drainage District, California for planning, design, and construction of projects to reduce flood risk and assist in groundwater recharge efforts in the Colusa Basin Watershed. The Secretary of the Interior may provide financial assistance to the Colusa Basin Drainage District, California for projects to reduce flood risk, assist in groundwater recharge, address overdraft and land subsidence, construct or preserve wetland and riparian habitat, and capture surface or stormwater for conservation and increased water supplies. SEC. 3. PROJECT SELECTION. Eligible projects for flood protection and integrated resources management must adhere to specific environmental guidelines and documentation requirements under federal and state laws. The Secretary must ensure project compatibility with watershed protection and environmental restoration efforts. The curr_chunk states that certain projects must align with environmental efforts under specific laws, such as the Central Valley Project Improvement Act and the CALFED Bay-Delta Program. The text chunk discusses cost sharing. The Secretary requires the District and cooperating non-Federal agencies to pay a percentage of costs for construction, operation, maintenance, and planning of projects. Funds from the Act can cover 65 percent of planning, design, and compliance costs. The Secretary treats contributions of lands and interests by the District to a project as payment for project costs. SEC. 5. Amounts spent under this Act are nonreimbursable. SEC. 6. Funds can be given to the District or local agency if they have a binding agreement with the Secretary. SEC. 7. Reimbursement is provided. SEC. 7. REIMBURSEMENT. The Secretary will reimburse the District or local agency for project work done before receiving funds under this Act, equal to the estimated Federal share of the cost. SEC. 8. COOPERATIVE AGREEMENTS. SEC. 8. The Secretary may enter into cooperative agreements with the District to assist in carrying out the Act's purposes, allowing the District to manage contracts and receive reimbursements. SEC. 9. Activities and financial assistance under this Act are not considered supplemental benefits under the Reclamation Reform Act of 1982. SEC. 10. Appropriations authorized. SEC. 10. Appropriations authorized up to $25,000,000 for the Secretary to carry out this Act, with additional funds if needed due to cost changes. Appropriations under this section remain available until expended.
